title: 'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Atul Subhash's Wife Nikita Singhania On Harassment Allegations - News18
summary:
'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Nikita Singhania Responds to Harassment Allegations

Date: December 17, 2024
Source: News18

Nikita Singhania, in a recent police investigation regarding her estranged husband Atul Subhash’s suicide, denied all allegations of harassment. She stated that she had been living apart from him for three years.

  • Nikita claims Atul harassed her, contrary to his accusations.
  • Atul Subhash's family expressed disappointment over the legal system, feeling it favors women.
  • Atul was found dead with a suicide note highlighting his struggles.
  • The police arrested Nikita and her family related to the case.
“Justice is due,” - Inscription from Atul's suicide note.

This incident has raised significant discussions on the domestic issues and legal protections available to men.
newTitle: 'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Nikita Singhania Responds to Harassment Allegations

title: ‘India was just an ally’: Bangladesh politicians upset over PM Modi's Vijay Diwas post - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bangladesh Politicians Criticize Modi's Vijay Diwas Post for Ignoring Bangladesh

Date: December 17, 2024, Source: HT News

Bangladeshi politicians expressed their discontent over Prime Minister Modi's social media post regarding Vijay Diwas, where he failed to mention Bangladesh's significant role in the 1971 liberation war.

  • PM Modi commemorated Indian soldiers’ victory over Pakistan on December 16, 1971.
  • Critics from Bangladesh highlighted the exclusion of their country in the context of the war's significance for their independence.
  • Increased tensions exist between India and Bangladesh over treatment of the Hindu minority in Bangladesh.
  • Bangladesh's ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been mentioned in relation to ongoing political instability in Bangladesh.
Asif Nazrul (law adviser to Muhammad Yunus): “I strongly protest. December 16, 1971, was the day of Bangladesh's victory. India was an ally in this victory, nothing more.”
“I strongly condemn and protest against Narendra Modi's misleading statement on 16th December, Bangladesh's Victory Day.” - Ishraque Hossain (Bangladesh Nationalist Party)

The reactions from Bangladeshi politicians signal potential strains in the diplomatic relationship between the two nations, emphasizing the importance of recognizing Bangladesh's history and sovereignty.
newTitle: Bangladesh Politicians Criticize Modi's Vijay Diwas Post for Ignoring Bangladesh

"Who's Going To Decide What I Wear?" Priyanka Gandhi On 'Palestine' Bag Row - NDTV
summary:
Who's Going To Decide What I Wear?' Priyanka Gandhi On 'Palestine' Bag Row

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV

Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has addressed the backlash over her use of a bag emblazoned with 'Palestine', calling the reaction a reflection of typical patriarchy.

  • Priyanka criticized BJP's protests against her choice of the bag, asserting her right to wear what she chooses.
  • The bag also featured a watermelon symbol, representing solidarity with Palestine.
  • Her comments come in the wake of criticism from BJP MPs, who accused her of appeasement.
  • The Congress MP urged the government to focus on protecting minorities in Bangladesh rather than on her bag.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs reiterated India's consistent stance on the Palestine issue, advocating for a two-state solution.
“Who is going to decide what clothes I wear now? That's typical patriarchy...” — Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

This incident has ignited a significant political debate, highlighting ongoing tensions around domestic and international perceptions of the Palestine issue.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Controversy Over 'Palestine' Bag

Delhi air pollution: AQI in Delhi-NCR breaches 400-mark, enters ‘severe’ category - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Air Pollution Reaches 'Severe' Levels, AQI Breaches 400-Mark

Date & Source: December 17, 2024, The Hindu

Introduction: Delhi's air quality has worsened, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) breaching the 400-mark and entering the 'severe' category.

  • Key Points:
    • Delhi's AQI was recorded at 421 on December 17, 2024.
    • Areas such as Anand Vihar, Ashok Vihar, Bawana, Jahangirpuri, and Alipur had AQI values ranging from 400 to 470.
    • The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) classified the local air quality in the 'Very Poor' category.
    • The India Meteorological Department (IMD) reported the minimum temperature in Delhi as 5 degrees Celsius.
AQI in Delhi-NCR breaches 400-mark, enters 'severe' category

Conclusion: The worsening air quality in Delhi highlights the urgent need for measures to mitigate pollution.
newTitle: Delhi Air Pollution Reaches 'Severe' Levels, AQI Breaches 400-Mark

title: Delhi's air quality ‘severe’ at over 420 as GRAP 4 returns | Check area-wise AQI - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi AQI Today: The Union government's Centre for Air Quality Management on Monday decided to reimpose Stage 4 curbs under GRAP in the National Capital Region.

Date: Dec 17, 2024

Source: HT News Desk

Delhi woke up to an ‘severe’ category air quality on Tuesday, with the overall AQI at 421 at around 8 am, according to the Sameer app of the central government.

  • Other NCR cities struggled with poor air quality; Greater Noida had an AQI of 398, while Noida, Ghaziabad, and Gurugram recorded AQIs of 382, 380, and 356 respectively.
  • The Air Quality Index in several monitoring stations in Delhi was critically high, with Alipur at 454 and Anand Vihar at 467.
  • Restrictions under Stage 4 of the Graded Action Response Plan (GRAP) include bans on construction activities and entry of polluting trucks into Delhi.
“On December 5, the Supreme Court lifted the GRAP 4 pollution curbs in Delhi NCR, citing improvement in AQI levels.”

With worsened conditions, the CAQM had reimposed restrictions effectively immediately to combat the deteriorating air quality.
newTitle: Delhi's Air Quality Hits 'Severe' Levels as GRAP 4 Restrictions Are Reimposed

title: Congress to hold March to Raj Bhawan on December 18 in Jammu - Cross Town News
HC grants anticipatory bail to Sushil Singhania in Atul Subhash suicide case - The Hindu
summary:
Atul Subhash suicide case: HC grants anticipatory bail to Nikita Singhania’s uncle Sushil Singhania

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Allahabad High Court has granted anticipatory bail to Sushil Singhania, the uncle of Nikita Singhania, in connection with the suicide case of AI engineer Atul Subhash. This hearing comes after multiple arrests were made related to the incident.

  • The court hearing was held before Justice Ashutosh Srivastava.
  • Nikita Singhania and her family have been accused of abetting Atul Subhash's suicide.
  • Sushil Singhania’s bail is based on concerns regarding a previous arrest and his medical condition.
“Considering the above, the court is of the opinion that applicant Sushil Singhania is entitled to get the privilege of pre-arrest (Transit) Anticipatory.”

The court also imposed conditions for Sushil Singhania's bail, including his availability for questioning by the police and restrictions on his travel.
newTitle: High Court Grants Anticipatory Bail to Sushil Singhania in Atul Subhash Suicide Case

title: ‘I Want To Kidnap You’: Uber Driver’s Text Leaves Gurugram Woman Terrified - News18
Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa discharged without surgery, Heads to court for bail formalities: report - TOI Etimes
summary:
Kannada Actor Darshan Thoogudeepa Discharged Without Surgery; Heads to Court for Bail Formalities

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 | Source: Bangalore Times

Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa has been discharged from the hospital after being granted interim bail on medical grounds, leaving without undergoing planned surgery for a back injury.

  • Darshan was initially granted bail by the Karnataka High Court, allowing him six weeks for medical treatment.
  • The intended surgery was postponed due to his high blood pressure.
  • Following his discharge, he went to the City Civil Court to complete bail formalities.
  • He is currently linked to the Renukaswamy murder case, with accusations of orchestrating the murder due to derogatory messages sent to his alleged girlfriend, Pavithra Gowda.
  • Darshan has faced legal troubles previously, including a 2011 arrest for domestic violence allegations.
“The messages sent by the victim suggested that Pawithra was tampering with Darshan's marriage.”

This situation marks a significant moment in the actor's life, as he navigates both health concerns and serious legal battles.
newTitle: Kannada Actor Darshan Thoogudeepa Discharged Without Surgery; Heads to Court for Bail Formalities

title: Plea before Allahabad High Court challenging impeachment motion against Justice SK Yadav - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Plea Challenging Impeachment Motion Against Justice SK Yadav Filed in Allahabad High Court

Published on: 17 Dec 2024, 2:14 am

Days after an impeachment motion was submitted against Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav for his controversial remarks, a plea has been filed in the Allahabad High Court challenging the motion.

  • The plea, filed by Advocate Asok Pande, requests the Rajya Sabha chairman to refrain from acting on the impeachment motion.
  • Justice Yadav's remarks at a VHP event sparked controversy, with claims of hate speech against the Muslim community.
  • The motion was signed by 55 MPs and addresses allegations of bias and violation of judicial ethics.
“Whatever Shekhar Kumar Yadav has said ... was in the capacity of a follower of the Santan Hindu Dharm not as a judge sitting on the chair in the court room.”

The motion aims to initiate an inquiry into Justice Yadav's conduct and statements, reflecting concerns over communal disharmony and hate speech.
newTitle: Plea Challenging Impeachment Motion Against Justice SK Yadav Filed in Allahabad High Court

title: GRAP Stage 4 imposed in Delhi as AQI hits ‘severe’: What's open, what's closed? | Today News - Mint
Cold wave reaches Hyderabad, parts of North India shiver in below 0 deg C | Key points - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cold Wave Reaches Hyderabad, Parts of North India Shiver in Below 0 deg C

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A cold wave is affecting many regions in India, including Telangana and Hyderabad, where temperatures have dipped significantly. Major cities are recording temperatures significantly below normal, with several areas experiencing severe cold conditions.

  • Delhi's Cold Snap: Recorded a minimum temperature of 4.5°C, prompting the reimposition of GRAP 4 restrictions due to poor air quality.
  • Freezing Temperatures in Kashmir: Srinagar recorded temperatures as low as -3.4°C.
  • Impact in Rajasthan: Fatehpur in Sikar district recorded lows of -0.4°C.
  • Conditions in Telangana: Hyderabad saw temperatures drop to 6.4°C with similar trends across the region.
  • Warnings Issued: Severe cold warnings have been issued for multiple states, with predictions of ongoing cold conditions.
“The prediction indicates a continuation of cold conditions with further drops in minimum temperatures expected across the region.”

The ongoing cold wave is anticipated to have lasting effects on both health and economic aspects for the affected regions, with additional warnings forecasting continued colder temperatures in the upcoming days.
newTitle: Cold Wave Hits Hyderabad and Parts of North India

title: One nation, one election: Bill to hold simultaneous polls to be introduced in Lok Sabha today - Hindustan Times
summary:
One nation, one election: Bill to hold simultaneous polls to be introduced in Lok Sabha today

Date: Today Source: Hindustan Times

The Lok Sabha will discuss a constitutional amendment bill aimed at synchronizing Lok Sabha and assembly elections. This move seeks to streamline the election process across India.

  • The bill has been referred to as the Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024.
  • Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal will introduce the bill in Parliament.
  • The bill proposes to amend Article 82(A) and other related articles to allow simultaneous elections.
  • Opposition parties are voicing strong concerns over the potential impact on democratic accountability and federalism.
  • Simultaneous elections are projected to begin in 2034.
“This impractical and anti-democratic move will erase regional voices, erode federalism, and disrupt governance.” – DMK Chief

The introduction of this bill reflects the government's effort to initiate significant electoral reforms while facing substantial opposition regarding its potential implications on democracy.
newTitle: Simultaneous Elections Bill to be Introduced in Lok Sabha

title: 'I want to kidnap you': Gurgaon resident shares Uber driver's frightening text, internet has a theory - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gurgaon Resident Shares Frightening Uber Driver Text Message

Date: Dec 17, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

A Gurgaon resident recently shared a distressing message received from their Uber driver, prompting the rider to cancel the trip in fear. The incident sparked discussions online about the driver's message and possible interpretations.

  • The rider received a bizarre text from their Uber driver right before their scheduled pickup.
  • The message included a threatening reference to kidnapping, causing immediate panic.
  • The user canceled the ride due to fear, and the driver canceled shortly after.
  • Some internet users speculated the message might have been a mistranslation or autocorrect error.
  • Uber has since banned the driver from accepting rides following the incident.
“I am shivering while I am actually writing this right now.” - The rider describing their emotional state during the ordeal.

This event highlights the importance of communication clarity and the user’s safety while using rideshare services.
newTitle: Gurgaon Resident Shares Frightening Uber Driver Text Message

title: NSA Ajit Doval to visit China for talks under Special Representatives mechanism - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajit Doval to Visit China for Border Dispute Talks

Publication Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

National Security Adviser (NSA) Ajit Doval is set to visit China to further discussions aimed at resolving the longstanding border dispute following recent disengagement on the Line of Actual Control (LAC).

  • Doval’s visit is expected to happen by the end of the year or early January.
  • The Special Representatives mechanism was initiated in 2003 to create a framework for settling the boundary issues.
  • Previous talks occurred to negotiate disengagement of forces after military tensions intensified in April-May 2020.
  • Doval will meet with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, his counterpart in these discussions.
  • This visit follows a series of high-level meetings between Indian and Chinese leaders aimed at normalizing relations.
“The Special Representatives mechanism was created in 2003 to explore the framework of a boundary settlement.”

The upcoming talks are crucial for addressing key border issues and maintaining stability in India-China relations.
newTitle: Ajit Doval to Visit China for Border Dispute Talks

title: India, China set to hold special representatives’ meeting tomorrow - The Indian Express
summary:
India and China to Hold Special Representatives’ Meeting in Beijing

Publication Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Indian Express

India and China, after recent official talks, are set to hold a Special Representatives’ meeting in Beijing, focusing on boundary issues amid improved relations following troop disengagement in eastern Ladakh.

  • The meeting is scheduled for December 18, 2024.
  • National Security Advisor Ajit Doval will represent India, while Foreign Minister Wang Yi represents China.
  • This dialogue follows the Working Mechanism for Consultation and Coordination (WMCC) talks held in Delhi on December 5.
  • The last Special Representatives’ dialogue occurred in December 2019.
  • Key topics include effective border management and de-escalation following a prolonged standoff.
“They also prepared for the next meeting of the Special Representatives, which is to be held in accordance with the decision of the two leaders in their meeting in Kazan on October 23.”

The upcoming meeting represents a critical step in stabilizing India-China relations, particularly concerning border issues.
newTitle: India and China to Hold Special Representatives’ Meeting in Beijing

title: Companies bring 'pet leave', 'live band days' for Gen Z staff - The Times of India
Higher EPFO Pension: Govt Should Immediately Implement Enhanced Pension Scheme, Says Premachandran - News18
summary:
Higher EPFO Pension: Govt Should Immediately Implement Enhanced Pension Scheme, Says Premachandran

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: News18

N K Premachandran, a Revolutionary Socialist Party MP, has called for the immediate implementation of an enhanced pension scheme as approved by the Supreme Court, allowing existing employees to opt for higher pensions.

  • The Supreme Court ruled on November 4, 2022, allowing existing employees to opt for a higher pension under the Employees’ Pension Scheme (EPS), 1995.
  • Only 8,401 out of 1,748,775 applications have been processed for higher pensions as of August 7, 2024.
  • Premachandran emphasized that employees are entitled to this higher pension and that the government should act swiftly.
  • The EPS 1995 aims to provide financial stability to employees after retirement.
“Employees are entitled to a higher pension under the EPS 1995,” said Premachandran.

The call for immediate action reflects the urgency of meeting the needs of employees who contribute to the EPFO.
newTitle: Govt Urged to Implement Enhanced EPFO Pension Scheme

title: Manoj Manchu Accuses Brother Vishnu Of Endangering His Family: 'It Could Have Led To Lives Lost' - News18
summary:
Manoj Manchu Accuses Brother Vishnu Of Endangering His Family: 'It Could Have Led To Lives Lost'

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: News18

The ongoing feud within the Manchu family has escalated, with Manoj Manchu accusing his elder brother Vishnu of endangering his family by tampering with home generators.

  • Manoj alleges that Vishnu and his associates broke into his home while he was away and sabotaged the generators.
  • They purportedly posed as cake delivery personnel to gain access to the house.
  • Manoj claimed that they mixed diesel and sugar in the generators, causing significant damage.
  • The tampering resulted in a power failure and dangerous electrical fluctuations.
  • He expressed concern for his family's safety, particularly for his mother and nine-month-old daughter.
  • Manoj stated that the incident is part of a troubling pattern of threats and hostility from Vishnu.
“This incident is not an isolated one but part of a growing pattern of threats and hostility,” Manoj said.

In light of these events, Manoj is calling for immediate action from authorities to prevent further incidents and ensure his family's safety.
newTitle: Manoj Manchu Accuses Brother Vishnu Of Endangering His Family: 'It Could Have Led To Lives Lost'

ACB set to proceed against KTR in Formula E case.. - Greatandhra
summary:
Telangana ACB Set to Act Against KTR in Formula E Race Case

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Great Andhra

The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) in Telangana is set to initiate action against K.T. Rama Rao following Governor's approval, addressing allegations of misuse of power related to the Formula E race.

  • The ACB will proceed based on the Governor's nod under the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • Cabinet discussions revealed the case involves misuse of funds during the Formula E race organization.
  • KTR has been accused of bypassing procedures to sanction funds for the race.
  • Formula E has canceled the upcoming race in Hyderabad due to breaches in the Host City Agreement.
  • KTR has publicly defended his actions, claiming no corruption and emphasizing the event's potential to elevate Hyderabad's global standing.
KTR: "I am ready to go to jail."

This development marks a significant move by the Telangana government amidst ongoing scrutiny and allegations surrounding past administrative decisions.
newTitle: Telangana ACB Set to Act Against KTR in Formula E Race Case
